data: Nico  Cappelluti Asst. Professor ncappelluti@miami.edu (203) 500-7429 Media / Outreach I am an assistant Professor at the Physics department of University of Miami. I am interested in employing wide field multiwavelength surveys for finding observational proxies of the formation mechanisms of Super Massive Black Holes in the Universe, determining the origin of Cosmic Backgrounds, studying Active Galactic Nuclei (AGN) clustering and investigate the nature of Dark Matter. 2007 Ph.D. Physics and Astronomy TUM-Munich/International Max Planck Research School (IMPRS), Germany 2004 M.S.
